content.description: Sit start on a quartz rail on the arete and slap hands up the arete using any undercling or little feet you can find until you come to a sloper rail at the top, that heel hook the side and go up to it then pop up to a good top out jug.
content.location: On the Rocking Horse Boulder on the arete of the overhang- (Next to Bite The Bits).

content.description: Start at the vertical crack and ledge around the corner on the right end of the boulder.  Traverse to the left without using the top edge of the boulder.  Top out on ledges just to the right of saddleback arete.  Long traverse, top out is easy, great for kids.
content.protection: Pad and spotter for top out
content.location: Far right of Rocking Horse boulder

content.description: Sit start on a side-pull ledge and get high feet to go up to a quartz nodule that is very sharp.  Get very high feet and press a hand against the side of the wall to your left, press your right hand onto the roof and get even higher feet, then bring your left hand up to the roof and dyno up over to a quartz jug and mantle over.
content.location: On the Rocking Horse Boulder right on the slightly overhanging part, go directly up the center.

content.description: Sit start lower left of arete on quartz rail.  Stay left of arete, left hand to quartz nodule, right up to crimp pinch, feet up, up to rail just over small roof jugs at top to top out.
1st Boulder...50 feet to the right of the trail Just after you cross the stream.
